tourDescription: Welcome! Explore campus at your own pace. Tap “Navigate” for each stop or open the full route in Google Maps.

stops.title: Student Services
stops.subtitle: One Stop Student Services Center
stops.description: Home of the One Stop Student Services Center. Find out the status of your admissions or financial aid applications, order transcripts and more. This building houses bursar/cashier services, DPRC, Counseling and Psychological Services, Career Services and Leadership Development, OneCard services, the Registrar’s Office, Undergraduate Admissions and Recruitment, and Veterans Services.

stops.title: Burk Hall
stops.subtitle: Education, Nursing, Vista Room
stops.description: Home to the Graduate College of Education, Family/Interiors/Nutrition/Apparel, and the School of Nursing. The student-run Vista Room restaurant is on the fourth floor.

stops.title: Student Health Center
stops.subtitle: Medical clinic
stops.description: Outpatient care for illness and injury, lab tests and X-rays, family planning, counseling and more. The student health fee covers most services.

stops.title: Ethnic Studies & Psychology
stops.subtitle: College of Ethnic Studies
stops.description: Home to the College of Ethnic Studies: Africana Studies, American Indian Studies, Asian American Studies, Latina/Latino Studies and Race and Resistance Studies. The Psychology Department is on the third floor.

stops.title: Gymnasium
stops.subtitle: Athletics & Kinesiology
stops.description: Home to the Athletics and Kinesiology departments. Features two gyms, an indoor pool, weight room and dance studios.

stops.title: Thornton Hall
stops.subtitle: College of Science & Engineering
stops.description: Home to the College of Science & Engineering. Check out the fourth-floor planetarium and the roof observatory.

stops.title: Hensill Hall
stops.subtitle: Biology
stops.description: The Department of Biology and many of its programs, services and labs are here.

stops.title: Science
stops.subtitle: Engineering & community partnerships
stops.description: The School of Engineering and the Marian Wright Edelman Institute are located here, where students and scholars collaborate with community partners to address the needs of children, youth and families.

stops.title: HSS
stops.subtitle: Health & Social Sciences
stops.description: Main offices of the College of Health & Social Sciences, plus ICCE, TRiO Student Support Services, CARP and Metro College Success Program.

stops.title: Business
stops.subtitle: Lam Family College of Business
stops.description: Home of the Lam Family College of Business. Students have access to resources including Metro Academies advisors, the Career Services and Professional Development Center and a computer lab.

stops.title: Administration
stops.subtitle: Campus administrative offices
stops.description: Administrative and business offices and some student/academic services including Undergraduate Advising, Bursar service station, ITS, Graduate Studies, Human Resources, the President’s Office and Undergraduate Education.

stops.title: J. Paul Leonard Library
stops.subtitle: Teaching & learning center
stops.description: A state-of-the-art teaching and learning center housing Special Collections & Archives, Sutro Library, Academic Technology, and the Center for Equity and Excellence in Teaching and Learning. Includes study/collaboration spaces, tech support, reservable rooms and a Digital Media Studio/MakerSpace.

stops.title: Cesar Chavez Student Center
stops.subtitle: Bookstore, food, murals
stops.description: Known for its many murals. Houses the SF State Bookstore, restaurants, lounges, a multicultural center, pub, student art gallery and ATMs. Home to Associated Students. An Information Desk is near the entrance closest to the Quad.

stops.title: Garden of Remembrance
stops.subtitle: Historic memorial
stops.description: Honors Japanese Americans — including 19 SF State students — interned during World War II.

stops.title: Fine Arts
stops.subtitle: Film, design, art studios
stops.description: Features a film soundstage, animation studio, recording/mixing rooms, editing labs, digital media labs, and collections preservation facility. Offices for Art, Cinema, Design and Anthropology. Screenings in August Coppola Theater. Fine Arts Gallery and Global Museum on the second floor.

stops.title: Creative Arts
stops.subtitle: Music, Theatre & Dance
stops.description: Home to the School of Music and the School of Theatre and Dance. Performances in McKenna Theatre, Knuth Hall, Studio Theatre, Little Theatre and more. Multiple set, costume and prop construction labs.

stops.title: Humanities
stops.subtitle: Liberal & Creative Arts
stops.description: Houses the College of Liberal & Creative Arts and most of its departments, plus the Poetry Center, American Poetry Archives and the American Language Institute.

stops.title: Village at Centennial Square
stops.subtitle: Apartment-style community
stops.description: Apartment-style community with eating options, a convenience store and different living communities. Furnished two- and three-bedroom apartments available for first-time freshmen.

stops.title: Mary Park / Mary Ward Residence Halls
stops.subtitle: Traditional residence halls
stops.description: Traditional residence hall communities for freshmen with resources, support and programs designed to facilitate successful transition to the campus community.

stops.title: Towers at Centennial Square
stops.subtitle: Suite-style housing
stops.description: Suite-style housing option for freshmen with furnished one- and two-bedroom units and Living Learning Communities. Adjacent Towers Jr. Suites offer semi suite-style housing with themed living communities.

stops.title: Mashouf Wellness Center
stops.subtitle: Recreation & wellness
stops.description: Student-driven facility with climbing wall, exercise studios, gym spaces, indoor pool with spa/sauna, jogging track, racquetball/squash courts and more. Offers programs like outdoor trips, workshops, personal training, intramurals and group fitness.

stops.title: Marcus Hall
stops.subtitle: BECA
stops.description: Home of Broadcast and Electronic Communication Arts (BECA) with cutting-edge multimedia labs and classrooms.

stops.title: Manzanita Square
stops.subtitle: Residential + retail
stops.description: Steps from campus, includes residential apartments, outdoor courtyard, retail, student support spaces and laundry facilities.

stops.title: University Park North
stops.subtitle: Apartment living
stops.description: Provides independent apartment living for transfer students, returning residents and students with families. Conveniently located next to campus with a variety of housing options.

stops.title: University Park South
stops.subtitle: Apartment living
stops.description: Provides independent apartment living for transfer students, returning residents and students with families. Conveniently located next to campus with a variety of housing options.
